explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since flash point of reagent grades was 66 degC, it was classified as Category 4. (Since industrial pure product diacetone alcohol includes acetone, there is also data that indicates 8 degC of flash point. Therefore, it is class 3 Division II and III in the UN Recommendations. Such commercial items with low flash point are classified as Category 2).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 603 degC and there is no spontaneous combustibility in normal temperatures.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on corrosion to metals

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 4000 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: SIDS (2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since the value (SIDS (2000)) of rabbit LD50= 13630mg/kg had exceeded 5000mg/kg (Category 5), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since there is no LC50 value, it cannot be classified. (It is assumed to be Category 3 to out of Category, since no death was observed on rats with 7.23g/m3 (1520ppm) (SIDS (2000)))

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 based on the information of moderate irritation in irritation test on rabbits (SIDS (2000)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2A using information of moderate or highly irritating with a rabbit (SIDS (2000), PATTY (5th, 2001)), and that there is irritation with humans (SIDS (2000), ACGIH (2001)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There were reports that it gave negative in vitro (SIDS (2000), PATTY (5th, 2001)), however, there was no in vivo information. Therefore we could not classify it.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since there is no information and other test data by evaluation organizations, it cannot be classified.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it is observed of declines conception rate, implantation count and implantation rate of reproductive potential and declines of total newborn count, delivery rate, neonatal count, live birth index, 4-days neonatal survival count and viability index on day 4 of offspring developmen (SIDS 2000)), it is classified into category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (respiratory); May cause damage to organs (liver); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since respiratory irritations and pulmonary diseases (SIDS (2000), ACGIH (2001)) are seen in human cases, it was set as Category 1 (respiratory system), and by the data that cases of liver is seen by 2ml/kg (equivalent : 1860mg/kg) rat oral taking (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), so it was set as category 2 (liver) from a guidance value. Since the anesthetic actions was seen in the animal (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), it is classified into Category 3.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (kidneys) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classfied into Category 1 (kidney) accoding to the description that "onset of nephrotic syndrome is used as the evidence of proliferative glomerulonephritis." in example of accident of humans at diacetone alcohol and ethanol exposure (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: No data available on chemical pneumonia

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: it carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50>100mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes), and others (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.00*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
